page.title: 08FARMING MILK LONG PRESTON
page.content: In our shippon we have 14 stalls and we milk 2 cows in each.Some of the new heifers don't like the milking machines and they kick them off.We feed them cake in buckets and the cows can drink from little basins by pressing a lever with their noses. The milk goes to the cooling house where we bottle it twice a day.My Dad fills 10 crates with 20 bottles in each.We put the tinfoil tops on with a rubber plunger.Mum and Dad start the milk round at 8.45 a.m.They use the landrover now but Grandad used a horse and cart with churns and pint and half pint jugs. We also have 150 sheep which we shear a field at a time.We put a mattress down and use electric shears.We keep the ewe lambs for 3 or 4 years but we sell nearly all the tup lambs.
